item.description:
Hi all,

By popular demand, we now turn to Thackeray's scorching satire, "Vanity Fair". Not your typical rags-to-riches story, it gives us a full view into the murky inner workings of Victorian society, as it chronicles the rise and fall of penniless femme fatale, Becky Sharp. True to its title, the novel catalogues an astonishing amount (and variety) of egotism and self-delusion along the way. Thackeray originally intended to call it "Pen and Pencil Sketches of English Society", which might give you a hint at the transformation that took place during the creative process.

Until the next meeting, I leave you with this:

"Ah! Vanitas Vanitatum! Which of us is happy in this world? Which of us has his desire? or, having it, is satisfied?" â€”Vanity Fair

Happy reading!

Arlinda

group.name: Classic Books: Book Club for Die-hard Readers

item.name: Vanity Fair, Part 1
